ACK ad345909b2465a65ee023b389fae342088e2f187\n\nThanks for doing this excellent cleanup work. Great feeling seeing Boost get purged.

We also/still depend on boost datetime, but it seems this one is a dependency of boost thread, so implicitly included here?


See also the `apt` command that installs datetime as a dependency of thread:


```
# apt install libboost-thread-dev
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
The following additional packages will

Perhaps, but I think we should only declare the libraries we explicitly need (just in case the dependency edges get pruned in the future).

Also, according to [the docs for our version of Boost.Thread](https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_70_0/doc/html/thread/build.html)

> Boost.Chrono: This dependency is optional (see below how to configure) and you will need to link with the library if you
